{
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Tue, 5 Jun 2001 07:03:23 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "queen28cmh@aol.com",
  "Good morning.  How are you today?  Mom told me you called last night and would be at EOTT all day, but I know you can get your email there.": ")  So how does the rest of the week look for lunch?  Are you free Wed. or Thurs.?  Let me know.  Next week I'll be gone to Regionals!!  I can't believe it has come up so fast.  I can't wait, but I also remember just how unpredictable Regionals can be so I don't want to get my hopes up about anything.  Of course, my two kids are being little angels which is making me feel pretty good about my chances so we'll see what happens.  Well, I better go do some actual work (although no one is even here yet so I'm not sure what exactly I'm supposed to do this morning), but oh well.  I'll talk to you later.  Have a good day.  I love you!!!",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c30177180.1075844981644.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "PS - Hopefully I will get my paycheck today!!!!!!": ")",

  "That's cool about lunch.  My tummy is feeling pretty gross anyway so it's best that I just live off salads and sandwiches this week anyway.  I am supposed to go to the meeting on Thursday, and would greatly appreciate a ride there and home.  After the meeting would you drive me to my car or home because I can get Mom to take me to the bus in the morning on Thursday if you'd rather take me home than drive all the way to the park\u0026ride.  It's up to you, just let me know what's easier for you.  Did you get your board book yet for the meeting?  I mailed them all out this morning and put a little note for you in yours.": ")  I hope you're having a good day.  I'll talk to you tonight.  I love you!!",
  "To": "stanley.horton@enron.com",

{
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Thu, 31 May 2001 08:38:56 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "Robert Looney, president, Texas Oil \u0026 Gas Associat",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c1673444.1075844983769.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Subject": "Wrapup of the 77th Legislative Session",
  "The 77th Session of the Texas Legislature adjourned sine die Monday, May 28th.  A wrapup report and a summary of legislation have been prepared reflecting the work the Association has done on the industry's  behalf during the session. {
  "Bcc": "dave.neubauer@enron.com, danny.mccarty@enron.com",
  "Bullets for NNG Marketing": "",
  "Cc": "dave.neubauer@enron.com, danny.mccarty@enron.com",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Fri, 21 Dec 2001 09:55:28 -0800 (PST)",
  "Duluth": "Negotiations with Duluth regarding avoiding a bypass have been slowed by Bud Krause, Manager of Systems Operation.  He is indicating that he now feels that there may not be enough \"value\" in the deal for Duluth.  Bob Stevens is setting up a meeting with NNG management and Duluth.",
  "From": "kent.miller@enron.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c12429599.1075855411609.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "MidAmerican": "Pleasant Hill - Preliminary agreements are being drafted concerning an escrow funding arrangement to address concerns of MidAmerican on Northern's credit worthiness with regard to the proposed Pleasant Hill Generation facilities.",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Subject": "Weekly Bullets",
  "Terra Chemicals": "After multiple discussions with Terra concerning their ability to activate an offset provision with Northern and other Enron affiliates, payment was received for their November 2001 reservation invoice of $309,000.",
  "To": "stanley.horton@enron.com",
  "Viking Gas Transmission": "NNG officially entered the recent VGT open season by requesting 35,000 MMBtu/day of delivery capacity at Browerville, MN ( a new TBS for VGT) and a receipt point at Chisago (the existing NNG interconnect).  This request is made in an attempt to lower ProjectMax expansion costs.  Our goal is to make this transaction work for $0.02/MMBtu/day.  This would be for the winter only, 15 years, beginning 11/1/2003.",
  "X-FileName": "shorton (Non-Privileged).pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\Stanley_Horton_Jan2002\\Horton, Stanley\\Deleted Items",
  "X-From": "Miller, Kent \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=KMILLER2\u003e",
  "X-Origin": "Horton-S",
  "X-To": "Horton, Stanley \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Shorton\u003e",
  "X-bcc": "",
  "X-cc": "Neubauer, Dave \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Dneubau\u003e, McCarty, Danny \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Dmccarty\u003e"
}

{
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Fri, 16 Nov 2001 13:59:36 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "caron.horton@trinity.edu",
  "I was really excited.  I didn't expect to get  it back today since we just took it Wednesday but we got it!!  I was so  happy because I was really expecting a B instead of an A this time.  I've  decided my brain must understand this better than I consciously thought it  did!!  Anyway, I was happy, and I hope the news brightens your day.  I  took my accounting test today and think I did pretty well.  It was the  hardest and longest one we've taken so far, but I still think I did well.   Our teacher drops our lowest test grade too so if it's not an A, it'll get  dropped.  I'm sure it's an A or B though since accounting and I seem to get  along well.": ")  Have a great rest of the day, and I'll talk to you  tonight.  I love you!!!",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c28445400.1075862325765.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Subject": "it's the weekend!!!!!!!!!!",

{
  "CC": "Brassfield, Morris \u003cMorris.Brassfield@ENRON.com\u003e",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Wed, 21 Nov 2001 08:49:58 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "Brassfield, Morris",
  "Here are my thoughts on the value the GSS (Global Strategic Sourcing) brings to ETS": "",
  "I believe totally in the concept of strategically sourcing our materials and services for ETS, which is the concept that GSS was founded under, while still within the ETS organization.  Basically the value that GSS has brought to the bottom line during the last year has been minimal to ETS.   The reasons for that statement, in my opinion, are": "",
  "If the GSS organization went away tomorrow, we would need the following expertise brought over from their group": "(currently this group is close to 75 people.)(and very highly paid individuals)",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c22103710.1075862327521.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Sent": "Wednesday, November 21, 2001 10:05 AM",
  "Subject": "Confidential - GSS Organization Value to ETS",
  "The administration of the following services would need to be shifted to the ISC": "",
  "To": "Saunders, James",
  "X-FileName": "SHORTON (Non-Privileged).pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\SHORTON (Non-Privileged)\\Horton, Stanley\\Deleted Items",

  "X-To": "Horton, Stanley \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Shorton\u003e",
  "X-bcc": "",
  "X-cc": ""
}

  "You are receiving this notification to alert you that e-mail services to your Blackberry device will be unavailable between the hours of  8": "45 a.m. and 12 midnight CST on Sunday, November 25th for maintenance. If you have additional questions regarding this outage, please contact the North American Resolution Center at 713-853-1411."

  "P\u0026L  Daily": "Daily change in the  mark-to-market (MTM) valuation of all deals being tracked in the Caminus Zainet system.   "To": "rod.hayslett@enron.com, jerry.peters@enron.com, danny.mccarty@enron.com,",

  "P\u0026L  Daily": "Daily change in the  mark-to-market (MTM) valuation of all deals being tracked in the Caminus Zainet system.  This includes the origination and changes in value for both the physical and financial sides of hedges, along with any speculative trades and floating unhedged physical positions.",
  "Subject": "RE: Daily Summary of Risk Data",
  "To": "vincent.strohmeyer@enron.com, rod.hayslett@enron.com, jerry.peters@enron.com,",
  "VaR is \"Value at Risk\"": "Enron Corp policy defines this as the maximum expected one day loss on the portfolio given a 95% statistical confidence interval. {
  "Bcc": "ermes.melinchon@enron.com, jeff.donahue@enron.com",
  "Cc": "ermes.melinchon@enron.com, jeff.donahue@enron.com",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Mon, 26 Nov 2001 19:55:01 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "mariella.mahan@enron.com",
  "GE": "a call took place this p.m. with GE to review status.  We made it clear to Mirant that progress on this front was slow and that we were concerned with their slow document turn around time.  Mirant committed to deliver comments on: the Guarantee, the Members Agreement, the Tax Agreement and also committed to delivering their version of the Share Purchase Agreement with GE, all by Thursday noon time.  The other document pending: the revised bylaws of the new entity where GE's preferred shares will be held, will be prepared by Cayman counsel; work had been held up on Mirant's non-agreement to cover legal fees; that too was resolved today and counsel should have been commissioned.",
  "Insurance": "(NOT A CP TO CLOSING) final report from third party adjuster has been sent to underwriter's office, care of in-house adjuster.  Unfortunately, the in-house adjuster is out on jury duty for two weeks.  I have a call into Jim B. to see what can be done to expedite the review and approval process.  Worst case here is that, if we insist on handling the claims post closing and Mirant agrees, we will have to guarantee a recovery amount to Mirant.  With the third party adjuster/CPA having signed off on the $26.1 million recovery amount, risk should be greatly mitigated.",
  "Lenders": "a call took place this a.m. with the entire syndicate of lenders (27 in total I believe).  Lenders will proceed to either remove conditions to their credit approvals and/or move forward with presentations to the credit committee - completion time is 1 to 2 weeks; lenders reiterated their ok with a Dec 14 satisfaction of all Cp's to the closing on the SPA with Mirant.  Lender's Agent (ABN Amro) committed to getting the lenders a copy of the \"as it stands\" lender consent agreement and also committed everyone to issuing a finalized lender consent document by this Friday.  This puts pressure on Mirant to deliver on final comments, following a series of lender counsel correspondence on the agreement (sent last week).",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c16867389.1075862328950.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Other": "Mirant has agreed to have a detailed conference call tomorrow at 5pm to review the \"Closing Checklist\".  This is very important in that up until now they have been reluctant to discuss any type of work plan and this, at least, gets us all comfortable that they understand the work ahead of us.  Additionally, we sent to Mirant (tonight) a revised side letter providing for the target date of Dec 14th for completion of all CP's, for a (no earlier than) Dec 19th (this is their request) and the elimination of the three business day float between closing of CP's and funding.  In this letter Mirant would commit to dedication of all resources, to diligently pursuing closing of CP's by 12/14 and to a work plan/checklist.",
  "Subject": "Eco Update",
  "To": "stanley.horton@enron.com, a..hughes@enron.com",
  "X-FileName": "SHORTON (Non-Privileged).pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\SHORTON (Non-Privileged)\\Horton, Stanley\\Deleted Items",
  "X-From": "Mahan, Mariella \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=MMAHAN\u003e",
  "X-Origin": "Horton-S",
  "X-To": "Horton, Stanley \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Shorton\u003e, Hughes, James A. \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Jhughes\u003e",
  "X-bcc": "",
  "X-cc": "Melinchon, Ermes \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Notesaddr/cn=cd827be4-b0ccc88a-86256b03-59098\u003e, Donahue, Jeff \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Jdonahu\u003e"
}

{
  "7-9pm": "Dance Lessons by DanceArts   \t\t \t\thttp://www.danceartsballroom.com",
  "9pm-12": "Dancing! with Live Swing Band. . .Chuck's Trio!",
  "CONTACT": "John A. Cote at ext. 33830",
  "Carmen, June 8-10, 2001 @ 8": "30pm nightly",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Cover Charge": "Minimum $5 Donation",
  "Date": "Fri, 1 Jun 2001 15:00:49 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Day": "Thursdays",
  "For More Info": "call 5-6528",
  "For more information about The Voices of Enron, contact Melinda Pharms, Vice President, of Education via e-mail at \u003cmpharms@ect.enron.com\u003e or by phone at 713/853-3866 - Internal Extension 33866 or Kathy Willard, Vice President, Membership at kwillar@enron.com \u003cmailto": "kwillar@enron.com\u003e, phone No. 713/646-7341 - Internal Extension 67341",
  "Friday afternoon (3": "00 - 6:00pm), July 13 through Sunday afternoon, July 15",
  "From": "no.address@enron.com",
  "HOW": "Share all sports activities, including canoeing, hiking, fishing, organizing a talent \t\t\tshow/bonfire/ghost stories, obstacle course, water balloon fights, softball, \t\t\t\tbasketball, archery, football, etc.  (Cooking and clean-up covered by the Houston Boys \u0026 \t\tGirls Club staff.)",
  "Houston Grand Opera's sensational Multimedia Modular Stage production returns for three FREE performances at Houston's Miller Outdoor Theatre on June 8-10 at 8": "30 p.m. Bizet's fiery gypsy Carmen, everybody's favorite femme fatale, ignites the summer in a powerhouse production that had audiences and critics cheering when it was first unveiled in 1998.",
  "If interested please contact LaShabriel Keys at 713.546.0283 or lkeys@houstongrandopera.org.  Check-in for volunteers will be at 6": "30pm nightly at the Volunteer Information Tent near the Miller Outdoor Theatre stage.",
  "Join the Enron Running Club at the Dad's Day 5K and 1 Mile Family Walk benefiting The Prostate Cancer Research and Awareness scheduled for Saturday, June 2nd.  If you're interested in running or volunteering your time, please contact Cindy Richardson at 713-853-4770 or Kelly Lombardi at 713-345-5841.  For more information, run to": "http://home.enron.com:84/erc/index.html.",
  "Kevin Hannon, Boys \u0026 Girls Club board member, invites you to join Enron employee John Cote at a Boys \u0026 Girls Club summer camp. John and Kevin are looking for commitments from some dedicated ENRON men \u0026 women. SPREAD THE WORD - SPOUSES, FRIENDS \u0026 OFFICE COLLEAGUES WELCOME - LAST YEAR'S CAMP WAS A HUGE SUCCESS! Details below": "",
  "Location": "Enron Building",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c15930890.1075844979666.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Please email Jennifer Milligan if you are interested in volunteering and indicate your preference in the below activities": "",
  "Please join Jeff Skilling at a press conference today at 10": "30 a.m. in Antioch Park to announce The United Way Scholars Program!  Your contribution is helping to provide 50 local high school students with college scholarships and funding for middle and high school technology programs designed to reach thousands of students each year!",
  "Subject": "Enron In Action 06.04.01",
  "The Enron Running Club is seeking runners, sprinters, discus \u0026 shot put throwers, high jumpers and long jumpers to compete in the annual USCAA Track \u0026 Field Championships on Saturday, June 9th at Rice University.  Participate in co-ed track relays \u0026 field events for all ages and abilities; showcase your energy and talents in a challenging, competitive, and fun environment; participate in an Enron tradition since 1994; experience teambuilding and camaraderie like never before!   "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Wed, 21 Nov 2001 08:52:26 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "Brassfield, Morris",
  "Here are my thoughts on the value the GSS (Global Strategic Sourcing) brings to ETS": "",
  "I believe totally in the concept of strategically sourcing our materials and services for ETS, which is the concept that GSS was founded under, while still within the ETS organization.  Basically the value that GSS has brought to the bottom line during the last year has been minimal to ETS.   The reasons for that statement, in my opinion, are": "",
  "If the GSS organization went away tomorrow, we would need the following expertise brought over from their group": "(currently this group is close to 75 people.)(and very highly paid individuals)",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c18660781.1075862331602.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Sent": "Wednesday, November 21, 2001 10:05 AM",
  "Subject": "Confidential - GSS Organization Value to ETS",
  "The administration of the following services would need to be shifted to the ISC": "",

  "Good morning.  How are you today?  Mom told me you called last night and would be at EOTT all day, but I know you can get your email there.": ")  So how does the rest of the week look for lunch?  Are you free Wed. or Thurs.?  Let me know.  Next week I'll be gone to Regionals!!  I can't believe it has come up so fast.  I can't wait, but I also remember just how unpredictable Regionals can be so I don't want to get my hopes up about anything.  Of course, my two kids are being little angels which is making me feel pretty good about my chances so we'll see what happens.  Well, I better go do some actual work (although no one is even here yet so I'm not sure what exactly I'm supposed to do this morning), but oh well.  I'll talk to you later.  Have a good day.  I love you!!!",

  "Sent": "Tuesday, June 05, 2001 1:48 PM",
  "Subject": "RE: morning 6/5",
  "That's cool about lunch.  My tummy is feeling pretty gross anyway so it's best that I just live off salads and sandwiches this week anyway.  I am supposed to go to the meeting on Thursday, and would greatly appreciate a ride there and home.  After the meeting would you drive me to my car or home because I can get Mom to take me to the bus in the morning on Thursday if you'd rather take me home than drive all the way to the park\u0026ride.  It's up to you, just let me know what's easier for you.  Did you get your board book yet for the meeting?  I mailed them all out this morning and put a little note for you in yours.": ")  I hope you're having a good day.  I'll talk to you tonight.  I love you!!",
  "To": "Horton, Stanley",

  "Date": "Fri, 9 Nov 2001 13:02:03 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "\"Caron Horton\" \u003cCaron.Horton@Trinity.edu\u003e@ENRON",
  "Hi Daddy!!!!!  I haven't gotten my WSJ today,  but I will or you can bring yours home for me to read if you want to.": ")  I can't wait to come home today.  I miss you bunches!!  I  haven't seen you in too long a time.  Are we still on for lunch  Saturday??  I hope so!!  Anyway, I'm not sure when I'll get home  today.  My last class gets out at 2:30, but David has an appointment at the  urologist at 3:00 so we can't leave till that's over so I'm not real sure when  we'll get out of here.  I know we're leaving right after that to come  home.  I'll give you a call tonight sometime though.  I love you and  will see you soon!!!!!!!!!!!!!1",
